results.title: Global energy game
results.creator_credit: Paul Galan, Michael Joseloff and Gateway Film Productions
results.brief_description: Economic journalist Adam Smith hosts a group of six players each representing a different country as they play a simulated game of international oil and global energy. Covers the trade balance and inflation in terms of oil costs and American dependence on foreign oil.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Galan, Michael Joseloff and Gateway Film Productions

results.title: Glitterball (Captioned)
results.brief_description: An alien spaceship crashlands on earth. It’s piloted by the Glitterball, a small silver creature with amazing powers, and an appetite for human food. With the help of two small boys, Glitterball causes chaos, and a lot of laughs as it eats its way back to outer space.

results.title: Glitter
results.brief_description: A young woman is catapulted into pop stardom, with her already-famous DJ boyfriend calling the shots.
results.description: A young woman is catapulted into pop stardom, with her already-famous DJ boyfriend calling the shots.

results.title: Glissements Progressifs du Plaisir = Successive Slidings Of Pleasure
results.creator_credit: Alain Robbe-Grillet, Marcel Sebaoun, Andre Cohen and Henri Boublil
results.brief_description:
Alice has been placed in custody in a juvenile detention centre run by nuns. She is accused of the murder of her flatmate who has been found tied up in bed, a pair of scissors in the heart. During questioning, Alice rants and raves, expressing all sorts of fantasies. Shocked at first, her lawyer becomes slowly fascinated by Alice’s behaviour and enters in a series of lesbian sex plays with her client.

Credits: Producers, Henri Boublil, Andre Cohen, Marcel Sebaoun ; director, Alain Robbe-Grillet ; writer, Alain Robbe-Grillet ; photography, Yves Lafaye ; music, Michel Fano ; assistant director, Luc Beraud.
Cast: Anicee Alvina, Olga Georges-Picot, Jean-Louis Trintignant, Michel Lonsdale, Jean Martin, Maxence Mailfort, Isabelle Huppert, Bob Wade.

results.title: Glimpses of Western India
results.creator_credit: S.N.S Sastry, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: Bombay and the sights to see nearby; Malabar Hill and the hanging gardens; the eight century Hindu cave temples of Elephanta island; Nasik and its pilgrims; Aurangabad the Mogul City; tombs of mediaeval kings; the Ellora caves; cave frescoes at Aguiba; the landscape and the life of the people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: S.N.S Sastry, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India

results.title: Glimpses of Gandhiji = Glimpses of Ghandhi
results.brief_description: A survey of the life or Mahatma Ghandhiji. Recalls his childhood; student life in England; the launching of the Satyagraha Campaign in South Africa and subsequently in India; and his martyrdom in January 1948 when a whole nation was plunged into mourning.

results.title: Glimpses of enchanting Japan
results.brief_description: A colourful variety of aspects of the land and nature of Japan. Beginning with the new year the film introduces the Grand Shrines of Ise, most honoured of the national shrines; the charming doll festival; the dramatic “water drawing’ rites of Nara are illuminated by torch light; the Mibu pantomime of Kyoto and the Dontaku festival of Hakata. Interspersed are shots of ancient temples and shrines contrasting with ultra-modern structures based on traditional architecture.
